project_preview_description.text: It's time for the Supreme Court to take internet privacy seriously.

project_preview_thumbnail.alt: A pen register like the kind at issue in Smith v. Maryland.

project_hero_image.alt: A pen register like the kind at issue in Smith v. Maryland.

project_description.text: Established in the mid-1970's, the third-party doctrine has long given law enforcement free reign to invade people's privacy without a warrant. In this article, I argue that the doctrine ought to be overturned and examine how the Court can reorient its Fourth Amendment jurisprudence to align with modern expectations of privacy.
